references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of diffusion models, which are central to the proposed GameFactory framework.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling through stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper is highly influential in the development of score-based generative models, a crucial component of the GameFactory approach.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is used in the GameFactory framework for evaluating the semantic relevance of generated videos to text prompts.
This paper presents a scalable transformer-based diffusion model, which is adopted as the backbone model in GameFactory.

references.paper_title: Video pretraining (VPT): Learning to act by watching unlabeled online videos
references.reason: This paper introduces the VPT dataset, which serves as a reference to the GF-Minecraft dataset for action annotation, providing insights into data collection methodologies.
